tidylife 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Compute period lifetables from mortality rates

    life_table.Rd

    All available years and ages are included in the tables. qx = mx/(1 + ((1-ax) * mx)) as per Chiang (1984). Warning: the code has only been tested for data based on single-year age groups.

    life_table(.data, age, sex, mortality)

    Arguments

    .data

    A tsibble including an age variable and a variable containing mortality rates.

    age

    Variable in `.data` containing start year of age intervals. If omitted, the variable with name `Age` or `Age_group` will be used (not case sensitive).

    sex

    Optional variable in `.data` containing sex information. If omitted, the variable with name `Sex` or `Group` will be used (not case sensitive).

    mortality

    Variable in `.data` containing Mortality rates (mx). If omitted, the variable with name `mx`, `Mortality` or `Rate` will be used (not case sensitive).

    Value

    A tsibble object containing the index, keys, and the new life table variables `mx`, `qx`, `lx`, `dx`, `Lx`, `Tx` and `ex`.

    References

    Chiang CL. (1984) The life table and its applications. Robert E Krieger Publishing Company: Malabar.

    Keyfitz, N, and Caswell, H. (2005) Applied mathematical demography, Springer-Verlag: New York.

    Preston, S.H., Heuveline, P., and Guillot, M. (2001) Demography: measuring and modeling population processes. Blackwell

    Examples

    # Compute Australia life table for females in 2003
aus_mortality |>
  dplyr::filter(Code == "AUS", Sex == "female", Year == 2003) |>
  life_table()
#> # A tsibble: 101 x 12 [?]
#> # Key:       Age, Sex, State, Code [101]
#>     Year Sex   State Code       mx      qx    lx      dx    Lx    Tx    ex   Age
